DataElement.preferredName: Patient Correlative Study Tissue Specimen Consent Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable coded response regarding the patient's consent for the use of tissue samples in a correlative study.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Correlative Study Tissue Specimen Consent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the patient's/participant's consent for the use of tissue samples for correlative study use.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Studies designed to translate basic science findings into clinically useful tools.  Includes marker research.:An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.:Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.:Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: A type of study that tests for a relationship between a condition and a potential causal factor of the condition.
An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.origin: SWOG CRF:Southwest Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is the patient willing to pro
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient willing to provide tissue specimen for a correlative study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient willing to provide tissue as required per protocol for central BRAF V600X mutation testing?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient willing to provide the biologic specimens (peripheral blood) required by protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient willing to provide mandatory tissue and blood samples for correlative studies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient willing to provide mandatory blood samples and tissue samples for correlative studies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient willing to undergo extra blood sampling for correlative studies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient willing to undergo extra blood sampling for correlative studies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient willing to provide blood for research purposes?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient willing to provide tissue and blood samples for correlative research?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient willing to undergo mandatory biopsies (day -14, approximately 4 hours post end of irinotecan infusion and Day 1, approximately 4 hours post end of irinotecan infusion (= 3 hours post end of M6620)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient willing to provide mandatory blood and tissue samples for correlative studies and central pathology confirmation of surgical specimens during study participation?
